title: Sidon Set
content:
A **Sidon set** (B_2 sequence) is a set where all pairwise sums a + b with a <= b are distinct.

Equivalently: a + b = c + d implies {a,b} = {c,d}.
mathContext: Named after Simon Sidon who studied these for Fourier series.

title: Distinct Sums Characterization
content:
Alternative definition: a + b = c + d implies {a,b} = {c,d} (as unordered pairs).

This is the symmetric version without the ordering constraint.

title: Equivalence of Definitions
content: The two Sidon definitions are equivalent. This is proved by careful case analysis on orderings.

title: Sidon Number h(N)
content:
h(N) = maximum size of a Sidon set in {1,...,N}.

This is the central quantity in the Erdos-Turan conjecture.

title: Sidon Sets Exist
content:
Sidon sets exist for any N - the empty set is trivially Sidon.

More interesting: singletons and arithmetic-progression-free sets work.

title: Erdos Problem #30 (OPEN)
content:
**Main Conjecture:** For every epsilon > 0, h(N) = N^{1/2} + O_epsilon(N^epsilon).

This asks if the error term can be arbitrarily small powers of N. Prize: $1,000.

title: Stronger Conjecture
content:
**Optimistic version:** h(N) = N^{1/2} + O(1).

Erdos considered this 'possibly too optimistic' but didn't rule it out.

title: Erdos-Turan (1941)
content:
**Original bound:** h(N) <= N^{1/2} + N^{1/4} + 1.

The starting point for all subsequent work. The N^{1/4} term has resisted improvement.

title: Lindstrom (1969)
content:
Slight improvement: h(N) <= N^{1/2} + N^{1/4} + 1/2.

Minor refinement of the constant term.

title: Balogh-Furedi-Roy (2021)
content:
**80-year breakthrough:** h(N) <= N^{1/2} + 0.998 * N^{1/4}.

First improvement to the N^{1/4} coefficient since 1941!

title: Carter-Hunter-O'Bryant (2025)
content:
**Current best:** h(N) <= N^{1/2} + 0.98183 * N^{1/4} + O(1).

State of the art upper bound.

title: Singer (1938)
content:
**Lower bound:** h(N) >= (1-o(1)) * N^{1/2}.

Constructed using perfect difference sets from finite projective geometry.

title: Explicit Lower Bound
content:
For infinitely many N: h(N) >= N^{1/2} - N^{0.525}.

Quantitative version of Singer's bound.

title: Required Upper Bound
content:
To prove the conjecture, we need h(N) <= N^{1/2} + C * N^epsilon for any epsilon > 0.

Currently stuck at epsilon = 1/4.

title: Perfect Difference Set
content:
A set D mod n where every non-zero residue appears exactly once as a difference d1 - d2.

These exist for n = q^2 + q + 1 where q is a prime power.
mathContext: From finite projective planes: lines in PG(2,q) give perfect difference sets.

title: Perfect Difference Sets are Sidon
content:
Perfect difference sets are automatically Sidon sets.

This is why Singer's construction works.

title: Singer Construction
content:
For prime power q, there's a perfect difference set of size q+1 mod q^2+q+1.

This gives Sidon sets of size about sqrt(N) for infinitely many N.

title: Example Sidon Set
content:
{1, 2, 5, 10} is a Sidon set.

Sums: 3, 6, 7, 11, 12, 15 - all distinct. Proved by exhaustive case analysis.

title: B_h Sets
content:
A **B_h set** has all h-wise sums distinct. Sidon sets are B_2 sets.

Generalizes to higher orders with similar questions.

title: Problem Status: OPEN
content:
**Erdos Problem #30 remains OPEN** with a $1,000 prize.

The N^{1/4} barrier has stood for 80+ years.
